title: Ring of shock resistance
data:
**[English]()**

 • [한국어](/wiki/Ring_of_shock_resistance/ko "Ring of shock resistance/ko")

| =          |                                                               |   |   |
| ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- | - | - |
| Name       | shock resistance                                              |   |   |
| Appearance | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |   |   |
| Base price | 150 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                             |   |   |
| Weight     | 3                                                             |   |   |

A **ring of shock resistance** is a type of [ring](/wiki/Ring "Ring") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Messages](#Messages)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [6.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
    - [6.2.1 Message](#Message)
  - [6.3 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [6.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

In addition to random generation, the ring of shock resistance can be sold in general [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") and jewelers' shops.

## Description

While worn, the ring confers [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance") - this prevents you from taking any [shock](/wiki/Shock "Shock") damage, though it can still affect your open inventory and destroy other [wands](/wiki/Wand "Wand") and rings. The ring of shock resistance is also immune to destruction from shock damage.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 9942b65d](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/9942b65df78dd55a7806ec), extrinsic sources of an elemental resistance now has a 99⁄100 chance of protecting your inventory from that type of damage.

## Strategy

An identified ring of shock resistance is a somewhat common choice of ring in the early and mid-game when dealing with monsters that pick up a [wand of lightning](/wiki/Wand_of_lightning "Wand of lightning"), as well as troublesome [shocking spheres](/wiki/Shocking_sphere "Shocking sphere") and [energy vortices](/wiki/Energy_vortices "Energy vortices") - thankfully, all but the energy vortex can be handled with relative ease once a character obtains the intrinsic. After this point, or once a character obtains [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"), it is best kept as an emergency measure for energy vortices: either source of the property blocks shock damage from exploding spheres, and reflection stops all damage from [rays](/wiki/Ray "Ray") of lightning.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

The ring protecting inventory from shock damage 99% of the time makes it much more useful against energy vortices and shocking spheres: the latter in particular explode in a 3x3 range rather than directly at their target as of [commit 6b60618e](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/6b60618e0e662b35b8e9c31dc9c4baee5ae70932), making the ring and other extrinsic sources of shock resistance an ideal defense, especially with the shocking sphere's destructive effects.

## History

The ring of shock resistance first appears in [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e").

## Messages

- Static electricity surrounds the sink.

  You dropped a ring of shock resistance into a sink - this will prompt you to type-[name](/wiki/Name "Name") the ring.

## Variants

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), many intrinsics are gradual rather than binary, allowing the ring of cold resistance and similar items to remain useful for much longer.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), the ring of shock resistance gives a message when worn, and like all extrinsic sources of shock resistance it also protects your inventory from shock damage. In addition, extrinsic sources of resistance properties are much more desirable, since many intrinsics in dNetHack time out depending on their source.

#### Message

- Your finger feels numb!

  You put on a ring of shock resistance.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), extrinsic sources of shock resistance and other elemental properties completely protect inventory from that element of damage for both the player and monsters.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), some intrinsics are gradual as in SporkHack rather than binary, including shock resistance, and reflection no longer completely protects you from the effects of elemental [rays](/wiki/Ray "Ray") - this makes the ring more useful in the short and long term. The ring of shock resistance is particularly desirable once you start encountering energy vortices and shocking spheres.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 4878](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/zap.c#L4878)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 5116](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/zap.c#L5116)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Ring of shock resistance

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 한국어

=
Name shock resistance
Appearance random
Base price 150 zm
Weight 3

A ring of shock resistance is a type of ring that appears in NetHack.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 History
  • 5 Messages
  • 6 Variants
    • 6.1 SporkHack
    • 6.2 dNetHack
      • 6.2.1 Message
    • 6.3 xNetHack
    • 6.4 EvilHack
  • 7 References

Generation

In addition to random generation, the ring of shock resistance can be sold in general shops and jewelers' shops.

Description

While worn, the ring confers shock resistance - this prevents you from taking any shock damage, though it can still affect your open inventory and destroy other wands and rings. The ring of shock resistance is also immune to destruction from shock damage.[1][2]

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Per commit 9942b65d, extrinsic sources of an elemental resistance now has a 99⁄100 chance of protecting your inventory from that type of damage.

Strategy

An identified ring of shock resistance is a somewhat common choice of ring in the early and mid-game when dealing with monsters that pick up a wand of lightning, as well as troublesome shocking spheres and energy vortices - thankfully, all but the energy vortex can be handled with relative ease once a character obtains the intrinsic. After this point, or once a character obtains reflection, it is best kept as an emergency measure for energy vortices: either source of the property blocks shock damage from exploding spheres, and reflection stops all damage from rays of lightning.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

The ring protecting inventory from shock damage 99% of the time makes it much more useful against energy vortices and shocking spheres: the latter in particular explode in a 3x3 range rather than directly at their target as of commit 6b60618e, making the ring and other extrinsic sources of shock resistance an ideal defense, especially with the shocking sphere's destructive effects.

History

The ring of shock resistance first appears in NetHack 2.3e.

Messages

Static electricity surrounds the sink.
You dropped a ring of shock resistance into a sink - this will prompt you to type-name the ring.

Variants

SporkHack

In SporkHack, many intrinsics are gradual rather than binary, allowing the ring of cold resistance and similar items to remain useful for much longer.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, the ring of shock resistance gives a message when worn, and like all extrinsic sources of shock resistance it also protects your inventory from shock damage. In addition, extrinsic sources of resistance properties are much more desirable, since many intrinsics in dNetHack time out depending on their source.

Message

Your finger feels numb!
You put on a ring of shock resistance.

xNetHack

In xNetHack, extrinsic sources of shock resistance and other elemental properties completely protect inventory from that element of damage for both the player and monsters.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, some intrinsics are gradual as in SporkHack rather than binary, including shock resistance, and reflection no longer completely protects you from the effects of elemental rays - this makes the ring more useful in the short and long term. The ring of shock resistance is particularly desirable once you start encountering energy vortices and shocking spheres.

References

  1. ↑ src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 4878
  2. ↑ src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 5116

A '''ring of shock resistance'''  is a type of [[ring]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''.

==Generation==
In addition to random generation, the ring of shock resistance can be sold in general [[shop]]s and jewelers' shops.

==Description==
While worn, the ring confers [[shock resistance]] - this prevents you from taking any [[shock]] damage, though it can still affect your open inventory and destroy other [[wand]]s and rings. The ring of shock resistance is also immune to destruction from shock damage.{{refsrc|src/zap.c|4878|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/zap.c|5116|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

{{upcoming|3.7.0|Per {{commit|9942b65df78dd55a7806ec}}, extrinsic sources of an elemental resistance now has a {{frac|99|100}} chance of protecting your inventory from that type of damage.}}

==Strategy==
An identified ring of shock resistance is a somewhat common choice of ring in the early and mid-game when dealing with monsters that pick up a [[wand of lightning]], as well as troublesome [[shocking sphere]]s and [[energy vortices]] - thankfully, all but the energy vortex can be handled with relative ease once a character obtains the intrinsic. After this point, or once a character obtains [[reflection]], it is best kept as an emergency measure for energy vortices: either source of the property blocks shock damage from exploding spheres, and reflection stops all damage from [[ray]]s of lightning.

{{upcoming|3.7.0|The ring protecting inventory from shock damage 99% of the time makes it much more useful against energy vortices and shocking spheres: the latter in particular explode in a 3x3 range rather than directly at their target as of {{commit|6b60618e0e662b35b8e9c31dc9c4baee5ae70932}}, making the ring and other extrinsic sources of shock resistance an ideal defense, especially with the shocking sphere's destructive effects.}}

==History==
The ring of shock resistance first appears in [[NetHack 2.3e]].

==Messages==
{{message|Static electricity surrounds the sink.|You dropped a ring of shock resistance into a sink - this will prompt you to type-[[name]] the ring.}}

==Variants==
===SporkHack===
In [[SporkHack]], many intrinsics are gradual rather than binary, allowing the ring of cold resistance and similar items to remain useful for much longer.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], the ring of shock resistance gives a message when worn, and like all extrinsic sources of shock resistance it also protects your inventory from shock damage. In addition, extrinsic sources of resistance properties are much more desirable, since many intrinsics in dNetHack time out depending on their source.

===xNetHack===
In [[xNetHack]], extrinsic sources of shock resistance and other elemental properties completely protect inventory from that element of damage for both the player and monsters.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], some intrinsics are gradual as in SporkHack rather than binary, including shock resistance, and reflection no longer completely protects you from the effects of elemental [[ray]]s - this makes the ring more useful in the short and long term. The ring of shock resistance is particularly desirable once you start encountering energy vortices and shocking spheres.
